item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

iamlies:

[size=24pt]you can change how the drops are calculated at this link (not meaning to advertise): http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=527769.0[/size]

Yea, great idea, load a shit ton of arrays, and did you even look over the code? It looks like it’ll drop waaaay to often with the rarity you have right now, and that’s a bad way of calculating it anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @iamlies iamlies
item.description:
@iamlies wrote:

[size=24pt]you can change how the drops are calculated at this link (not meaning to advertise): http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=527769.0[/size]

also, can someone check over my code please, i still get the error where it crashes the whole client :S

[code]public class Casket {

    public static int highLevelReward[] = {
            1079, 1093, 1113, 1127,
            1147, 1201, 1053, 1055,
            1303, 1319, 1333, 13740,
            1359, 1373, 2491, 2497,
  13742, 2503, 861, 859,
  2581, 13744, 2651, 1037,
  981, 1163, 1185, 4151, 
            1057, 11235, 4087, 4585,
            11283, 11732, 11730, 14479
    };//change these numbers to your item id's
    
    public static int highLevelStacks[] = {
             995, 386, 561, 563, 560, 892
    };
    public static int allStacks[] = {
            995, 380, 561, 886,
            374, 561, 563, 890,
            386, 560, 892
    };
    
    public static void addCasketReward(Client c, int clueLevel) {
            int chanceReward = Misc.random(2);
            if(clueLevel == 2) {
                    switch (chanceReward) {
                            case 0: 
                            displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, highLevelStacks[Misc.random(6)], 1 + Misc.random(350)); 
                            break;
                            case 1: 
                            displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, highLevelStacks[Misc.random(6)], 1 + Misc.random(350), -1, 1); 
                            break;
                            case 2: 
                            displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, -1, 1, -1, 1); 
                            break;//displays the reward when you click the casket (2717)
                    }
            }
    }[/code]

thanks

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @iamlies iamlies
item.description:
@iamlies wrote:

you can change how the drops are calculated at this link (not meaning to advertise): http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=527769.0

also, can someone check over my code please, i still get the error where it crashes the whole client :S

[code]public class Casket {

    public static int highLevelReward[] = {
            1079, 1093, 1113, 1127,
            1147, 1201, 1053, 1055,
            1303, 1319, 1333, 13740,
            1359, 1373, 2491, 2497,
	13742, 2503, 861, 859,
	2581, 13744, 2651, 1037,
	981, 1163, 1185, 4151, 
            1057, 11235, 4087, 4585,
            11283, 11732, 11730, 14479
    };//change these numbers to your item id's
    
    public static int highLevelStacks[] = {
             995, 386, 561, 563, 560, 892
    };
    public static int allStacks[] = {
            995, 380, 561, 886,
            374, 561, 563, 890,
            386, 560, 892
    };
    
    public static void addCasketReward(Client c, int clueLevel) {
            int chanceReward = Misc.random(2);
            if(clueLevel == 2) {
                    switch (chanceReward) {
                            case 0: 
                            displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, highLevelStacks[Misc.random(6)], 1 + Misc.random(350)); 
                            break;
                            case 1: 
                            displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, highLevelStacks[Misc.random(6)], 1 + Misc.random(350), -1, 1); 
                            break;
                            case 2: 
                            displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(36)], 1, -1, 1, -1, 1); 
                            break;//displays the reward when you click the casket (2717)
                    }
            }
    }[/code]

thanks

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Derpington, post:36, topic:386376”]Sometimes when I open a casket (1/4 chance or something) The casket disappears, and you don’t get a reward.

This pops up in the server source when that happens:

[19-2-12 15:14]: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 43 [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.minigames.Casket.addCasketReward(Casket. java:51) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.packets.ClickItem.processPacket( ClickItem.java:22) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.PacketHandler.processPacket(Pack etHandler.java:138) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.Client.processQueuedPackets(Clie nt.java:849) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHand ler.java:136) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:151)

It’s not that of a big problem, but I think it will be annoying some players, so do you know how to fix that?

Also, I want to make the drop rate of the casket like 50-75% on let’s say, Bandos. Do you know how to do that?

Cause 2717:1 just means that WHEN it drops a casket, it drops 1, right?
I noticed there’s 2 lines of numbers for each monster, is it like: first line the drops, and the amount and second line the drop rate?

So it would be(?)
2717:1
2717:75 <— 75% drop rate of a casket?

Other than that, awesome tutorial[/quote]

2717:75
item id:amount

PI’s drops are SHIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT. Rarity is based on how many times you add it, so the more 2717:75 that appear, the less rare.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @iamlies iamlies
item.description:
@iamlies wrote:

[quote=“Derpington, post:36, topic:386376”]Sometimes when I open a casket (1/4 chance or something) The casket disappears, and you don’t get a reward.

This pops up in the server source when that happens:

[19-2-12 15:14]: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 43 [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.minigames.Casket.addCasketReward(Casket. java:51) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.packets.ClickItem.processPacket( ClickItem.java:22) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.PacketHandler.processPacket(Pack etHandler.java:138) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.Client.processQueuedPackets(Clie nt.java:849) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHand ler.java:136) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:151)

It’s not that of a big problem, but I think it will be annoying some players, so do you know how to fix that?[/quote]

hey, it is to do with the array.length. It’s to do with how many integers are in there:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:34, topic:386376”]public static int highLevelReward[] = { 1079, 1093, 1113, 1127, 1147, 1201, 1053, 1055, 1303, 1319, 1333, 13740, 1359, 1373, 2491, 2497, 13742, 2503, 861, 859, 2581, 13744, 2651, 1079, 1037, 981, 1127, 1147, 1163, 1185, 4151, 1057, 11235, 11235, 4087, 4585, 1333, 1359, 11283, 2491, 2497, 2503, 11732, 11730, 2581, 2651, 14479 };[/quote]

change the

displayReward(c, highLevelReward[Misc.random(52)], 1, highLevelReward[Misc.random(52)], 1, highLevelStacks[Misc.random(5)], 1 + Misc.random(350));
i cant help with the rest as i changed my drop code on my PI server

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @Derpington Derpington
item.description:
@Derpington wrote:

Sometimes when I open a casket (1/4 chance or something) The casket disappears, and you don’t get a reward.

This pops up in the server source when that happens:

[19-2-12 15:14]: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 43 [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.minigames.Casket.addCasketReward(Casket. java:51) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.packets.ClickItem.processPacket( ClickItem.java:22) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.PacketHandler.processPacket(Pack etHandler.java:138) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.Client.processQueuedPackets(Clie nt.java:849) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.model.players.PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHand ler.java:136) [19-2-12 15:14]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:151)

It’s not that of a big problem, but I think it will be annoying some players, so do you know how to fix that?

Also, I want to make the drop rate of the casket like 50-75% on let’s say, Bandos. Do you know how to do that?

Cause 2717:1 just means that WHEN it drops a casket, it drops 1, right?
I noticed there’s 2 lines of numbers for each monster, is it like: first line the drops, and the amount and second line the drop rate?

So it would be(?)
2717:1
2717:75 <— 75% drop rate of a casket?

Other than that, awesome tutorial

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

No, my code was

switch(itemId) { case 2717: c.getItems().deleteItem(itemId, 1); Casket.addCasketReward(c, 2); break; }//opens the casket ofc

So that bracket is needed because it’s closing the switch statement.

Read full topic

case 2717: c.getItems().deleteItem(itemId, 1); Casket.addCasketReward(c, 2); break; }//opens the casket ofc

should be

u added a extra bracket thats unneed and creates errors

item.title: [PI] Adding a casket system to your bosses
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Add pkkid, just add more items in. Currently theres 10 or 20 i think. Lets say theres 20, theres a 1 in 20 chance of receiving a divine etc. If you add in another item theres a 1 in 21 chance.
Put low value items in or more high value items in. For example,
Mines is basically a rare + korosi box I charge 500m a box its roughly 1 in 3 for a good item(good way to take gp out of the economy btw).
Thanks asshole_rule :), would rep if you werent 200 xD

Read full topic
